title: Visual-Inertial SLAM for Agricultural Robotics: Benchmarking the Benefits and Computational Costs of Loop Closing
abstract: arXiv:2408.01716v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM) is essential for mobile robotics, enabling autonomous navigation in dynamic, unstructured outdoor environments without relying on external positioning systems. In agricultural applications, where environmental conditions can be particularly challenging due to variable lighting or weather conditions, Visual-Inertial SLAM has emerged as a potential solution. This paper benchmarks several open-source Visual-Inertial SLAM systems, including ORB-SLAM3, VINS-Fusion, OpenVINS, Kimera, and SVO Pro, to evaluate their performance in agricultural settings. We focus on the impact of loop closing on localization accuracy and computational demands, providing a comprehensive analysis of these systems' effectiveness in real-world environments and especially their application to embedded systems in agricultural robotics. tldr: 该文章详细评估了几种开源的视觉惯性SLAM系统在农业环境中的性能，其中特别关注了回环闭合对定位精度和计算需求的影响。研究结果表明，回环闭合对提高定位精度具有显著效应，但同时也增加了计算成本。此外，研究还分析了不同图像拍摄频率对定位精度所产生的影响。文章提出的这些评估对于将这些SLAM系统应用于嵌入式系统中具有重要意义，尤其是在农业机器人领域。
